text:
Which types of operations is julia still lacking behind compared with C in terms of preformamce?
Are these performance issues related to inherent issues with Julia or simply due to julias relative immaturity?

text: Good to know that Julias limitations dont affect performance. Thanks

elements.text: Good to know that Julias limitations dont affect performance. Thanks

text: shooting yourself in the foot with pointers?

elements.text: shooting yourself in the foot with pointers?

text: I think the biggest footgun for me personally has been type instability; if you avoid it then you really do get C-like performance, but if you miss any then it’s another story. `@code_warntype` FTW

elements.text: I think the biggest footgun for me personally has been type instability; if you avoid it then you really do get C-like performance, but if you miss any then it’s another story.

text: the problems I always run into are related to compiler optimizations that may or may not occur, and its hard to tell when they'll actually happen and its sometimes hard to force them to happen

elements.text: the problems I always run into are related to compiler optimizations that may or may not occur, and its hard to tell when they'll actually happen and its sometimes hard to force them to happen

text: things like eliding certain small heap allocations or union splitting
